decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - 
1/ The proposed retention of the boundary wall, would, by reason of its size, position and appearance be unduly obtrusive and out of character with, and not serve to preserve or enhance character of the Osterley Park Conservation Area, and is contrary to the Unitary Development Plan Policy ENV-B 2.2 (Conservation Areas).

2/ The proposed retention of the boundary wall would, when combined with access to the vehicle crossover with high column walls either side be a potential hazard.  When vehicles move in and out of the parking area, through the opening in the boundary wall, there would be a road safety hazard to passing pedestrians, detrimental to the amenities of adjoining occupiers and the free flow of traffic and are contrary to the Unitary Development Plan Policies ENV-B 1.1 (New Development) and T.4.4 (Road Safety).
description: Retention of front boundary wall and installation of gates and railings.
